tutorial: Testing a Trading Idea - The Other Stages

definition.text: Take a look at the nodes under Initial Targets. Do you have an intuition as to what they may be about?

paragraphs.text: These are the first few basic definitions required:

Target Rate is a reference rate. Think of it as a ball-park rate at which you wish to enter the position. There is a lot more depth to this concept, but the simplification serves us well at this point.
The Target Size In Base Asset and it's brother node, target size in quoted asset, is the definition of the maximum size the position should achieve.
The final rates and size is determined later on, in the definitions of the Execution Algorithm.
